other_tests.findings: A heterozygous point mutation, c488C > G (S163X), was identified in the MR gene of the index patient. The father exhibited the same mutation without symptoms.
Elevated plasma aldosterone (1.73 ng/ml) and plasma renin activity (20.5 ng/ml) were detected. Other steroids and plasma creatinine were normal.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After treatment, plasma aldosterone and PRA normalized.
Maintained growth improvements with oral NaCl therapy; plasma electrolytes remained normal.
